title: Russie : face aux p√©nuries, des entreprises jouent la carte du "made in Russia"
cleaned_sentences: Russia: Faced with shortages, companies play the "made in Russia" card As a result of economic sanctions against Russia due to the invasion of Ukraine, Russian companies no longer receive components or raw materials.
Faced with the risk of shortages, some adapt and highlight local manufacturing.
Report in the suburbs of Moscow and Saint Petersburg.
To display this YouTube content, it is necessary to allow audience and advertising measurement cookies.
An extension of your browser seems to block the loading of the video player.
To be able to look at this content, you must deactivate it or uninstall it.
In the restaurant "La Famiglia", located in the suburbs of Moscow, business has been working rather well since the start of the Russian intervention in Ukraine.
The neighboring McDonald's has certainly closed its doors but that is not the only reason, according to its manager.
Artiom Kolesnikov thinks that residents no longer leaving abroad and spending more in Russia.
Same pragmatism in the oldest factory in Russian watches, Raketa.
If the brand, bought by a Frenchman in 2011, is experiencing difficulties in continuing to manufacture certain models, it is delighted to see new customers arrive.
"We have been fighting for 10 years to try to explain to the Russians that it is not only the Swiss watches that exist.
Russian watches are also qualitative, it tells great history.
And there, for two months this message passes much better," explains David Henderson-Stewart, Director General of Raketa Watches.
